chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randal J. Spencer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: see 15CF231
see 15CF231

Defendant RANDAL J. Spencer in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called a 15CF231 & 16CF43   Calles at 1:50 pm  Plea agreement stated, def to plea to Ct 2 & 3 on 15CF231 Ct 1 to be dismissed.  16CF43 to be DRI.  Victim rights have been complied with.   State is requesting withheld sentence, probation with conditions.  Def agrees with plea agreement.   Right to an atty reviewed with def.  Def waives right to counsel.  Court will accept waiver of counsel.  Plea questionnaire form reviewed with def.  15CF231 Ct 2 No contest plea.  Ct. 3 No contest plea.  Court will dismiss Ct 1.  Court will dismissed and read in 16CF43, def has obtained his drivers license.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed with def.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Facts set forth.  Factual basis for pleas.  Pleas accepted and found guilty.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison for sentencing.  Nothing by def.  Court will accept plea agreement.  Ct 2 Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation.  AODA and follow through with all recommendations.  Court cost  plus DNA surcharge & sample.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Ct 3 Sentence withheld, 1 yrs probation.  Concurrent.  AODA .  Court cost & DNA surcharge.  Post conviction rights.  No credit.  Review of bonds.  State moved to forfeit $500. bond.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Statement by def.  Court finds reasons not to forfeit $500. bond.  Cost to be taken from bonds and balance to def.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Randal J. Spencer
Current: 827 5th Ave, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2016) see 15CF231
Prior: 613 1/2 Washington Ave, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant RANDAL J. Spencer in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF231 and 16CF43.  15CF231 is set for bond forfeiture.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison in regards to status of cases.  Issue of counsel.  Court questions def.  Def is requesting that the deal that was previously agreed to be set for plea and sentencing.  Court will hold open the bond forfeiture.  Court instructs clerk to give waiver of right to atty and plea questionnaire to def.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Randal J. Spencer in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge reviews court record as to status of case.  Statement by def.  Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

State moves to forfeit bond in 15CF231, warrant requested with bond $1000 or body.  Def was sent notice for today.  Court will authorize warrant, $1000. or body State wide.  Court will forfeit bond pending hearing

Defendant Randal J. Spencer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF43 and 15CF231 @ 3:39 p.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF231 & 16CF43 @ 11:50 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg. Adjourn for status/possible plea & sentencing.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Randal J. Spencer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF231 & 16CF43  @ 10:39, 15CF231 Court corrects caption to read Randal with one L. Waiver of preliminary examination.  Atty Laufenberg waives p.h.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing on both cases.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over.  Informations Filed. Atty Laufenberg has copy of information on both cases, waives reading, reserve rights and enters Not Guilty plea on both cases on all ct's.  Court receives not guilty plea on all ct's in both cases and directs Clerk to enter.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 11:15 am.
of Preliminary Examination - See 15-CF-231

Defendant Randall J. Spencer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:37 p.m. Discussion.  Copy received, reading waived. Request prelim hrg, however, waive time limits. 16CF43 called - copy of complaint received, reading waived. Def advises correct spelling of first name is Randal. Court directs correction of caption. Both set for either prelim or waiver, Atty Laufenberg will notify State ahead of time.  Waiver of time limits for prelim is for both files. Court reviews with Def and accepts waiver.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
